intro: Borinda subflexuosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf borinda, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming during spring and summer. Borinda subflexuosa is often found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
